biasIndicators.title: Bias Indicators
biasIndicators.noResults: No bias indicators found. Analyze text to see results.

overgeneralizations.title: Overgeneralizations
overgeneralizations.explanation: The term '{{phrase}}' is an overgeneralization that leaves no room for exceptions and may present oversimplified conclusions.
overgeneralizations.suggestedFix: Consider using more nuanced language that allows for exceptions and individual variations.

absoluteTerms.title: Absolute Terms
absoluteTerms.explanation: The term '{{phrase}}' is an absolute term that may close off debate and present information as indisputable.
absoluteTerms.suggestedFix: Consider using more nuanced language to allow for alternative perspectives.

capitalisation.title: Excessive Capitalisation
capitalisation.explanation: Writing in all caps may imbue extra significance.
capitalisation.suggestedFix: If the phrase is not an acronym, consider using standard capitalization.

chargedSemanticFields.title: Charged Semantic Fields
chargedSemanticFields.explanation: The term '{{phrase}}' is a borrowed phrase from a field with strong connotations that may influence the reader's perception.
chargedSemanticFields.suggestedFix: Avoid using words from charged semantic fields to maintain neutrality.

concessiveConnectives.title: Concessive Connectives
concessiveConnectives.explanation: The connective '{{phrase}}' may be used to downplay counterarguments by acknowledging them while still maintaining the main point.
concessiveConnectives.suggestedFix: Consider presenting counterarguments more neutrally or giving them equal weight.

dysphemisms.title: Dysphemisms
dysphemisms.explanation: The phrase '{{phrase}}' is a dysphemism that may convey a negative or derogatory connotation.
dysphemisms.suggestedFix: Use neutral or positive language to avoid derogatory implications.

ellipses.title: Ellipsis Usage
ellipses.explanation: The ellipsis may suggest hesitation or suggest hidden meaning.
ellipses.suggestedFix: Review if any hidden meaning should be clarified.

emotionallyChargedAdjectives.title: Emotionally Charged Adjectives
emotionallyChargedAdjectives.explanation: The adjective '{{phrase}}' is emotionally charged and may influence the reader's perception.
emotionallyChargedAdjectives.suggestedFix: Consider using more neutral language to describe the subject.

euphemisms.title: Euphemisms
euphemisms.explanation: The phrase '{{phrase}}' is a euphemism that may soften or obscure the true meaning.
euphemisms.suggestedFix: Use direct and clear language to convey the intended meaning.

eventLabeling.title: Event Labeling
eventLabeling.explanation: The phrase '{{phrase}}' may carry biased connotations in labeling events.
eventLabeling.suggestedFix: Use neutral terms to describe events.

exclamationQuestionMarks.title: Overuse of Punctuation
exclamationQuestionMarks.explanation: The repetition ('{{phrase}}') may provoke an emotional response.
exclamationQuestionMarks.suggestedFix: Try to use only one exclamation or question mark.

framingByTime.title: Framing By Time
framingByTime.explanation: The phrase '{{phrase}}' frames the event in terms of time, potentially implying relevance or obsolescence.
framingByTime.suggestedFix: Use neutral language that does not emphasize temporal framing unless necessary.

historicallyDerogatoryTerms.title: Historically Derogatory Terms/Slurs
historicallyDerogatoryTerms.explanation: The phrase '{{phrase}}' is considered historically derogatory or a slur.

intensifyingAdverbs.title: Intensifying Adverbs
intensifyingAdverbs.explanation: The adverb '{{phrase}}' may be intensifying and therefore overly exaggerate qualities.
intensifyingAdverbs.suggestedFix: Consider using a less charged adverb or not using the adverb at all.

italicsBoldface.title: Formatting Bias
italicsBoldface.suggestedFix: Consider removing the formatting or using it more sparingly.

mitigators.title: Mitigator
mitigators.explanation: The mitigator '{{phrase}}' can downplay the seriousness or importance of the subject.
mitigators.suggestedFix: Remove the mitigator and simply state the fact.

oversimplifiedGroupLabels.title: Oversimplified Group Labels
oversimplifiedGroupLabels.explanation: The term '{{phrase}}' oversimplifies or stereotypes a group of people.
oversimplifiedGroupLabels.suggestedFix: Use more specific and respectful language to describe individuals or groups.

passiveVoice.title: Passive Voice
passiveVoice.suggestedFix: Consider using active voice for clearer, more direct communication

rhetoricalQuestion.title: Rhetorical Question
rhetoricalQuestion.explanation: This may be a rhetorical question (confidence: {{confidence}})
rhetoricalQuestion.suggestedFix: Reconsider whether the point can be made more directly.

sarcasm.title: Sarcasm
sarcasm.suggestedFix: Rephrase this sentence to convey your intended meaning without the sarcastic tone.

oversimplifiedComparison.title: Oversimplified Comparison
oversimplifiedComparison.explanation: This phrase could contain an oversimplified comparison that ignores important nuances.
oversimplifiedComparison.suggestedFix: Try using more direct and specific language to convey the intended meaning.

referentialAmbiguity.title: Referential Ambiguity
referentialAmbiguity.explanation: This phrase uses vague references that can signal bias.
referentialAmbiguity.suggestedFix: Replace vague pronouns with specific terms to clarify the subject.

subordinateClauses.title: Subordinate Clauses
subordinateClauses.explanation: This sentence contains a subordinate clause that diminishes the main clause.
subordinateClauses.suggestedFix: State the main idea clearly without downplaying it with a subordinate clause.

doubleEntendres.title: Double Entendres
doubleEntendres.explanation: This sentence uses a double entendre that could have a biased meaning.
doubleEntendres.suggestedFix: Use clear and unambiguous language to avoid potential misinterpretations.

tagQuestions.title: Tag Questions
tagQuestions.explanation: This sentence uses a tag question that can imply agreement and nudge the reader.
tagQuestions.suggestedFix: Remove the tag question to avoid implying agreement.

contextualFraming.title: Contextual Framing
contextualFraming.explanation: This sentence uses contextual framing that biases the narrative by presenting premises as justifying conclusions.
contextualFraming.suggestedFix: Rephrase to present facts objectively without framing them to justify conclusions.

sentiment.title: Sentiment Analysis
sentiment.noResults: Sentiment analysis is not supported for this language.

conclusions.positiveTrajectory: The sentiment becomes more positive over the course of the text. This suggests a buildup toward a positive conclusion or a resolution of earlier negativity.
conclusions.negativeTrajectory: The sentiment becomes more negative over the course of the text. This could influence the reader's perception by softening the impact of negative information presented later.
conclusions.veryPositive: The overall sentiment is very positive. This could indicate a lack of critical perspective.
conclusions.veryNegative: The overall sentiment is very negative. This suggests a lack of including other perspectives.
conclusions.leansPositive: The overall sentiment leans positive. Consider balancing with more neutral or critical viewpoints.
conclusions.leansNegative: The overall sentiment leans negative. Consider incorporating more positive perspectives.
conclusions.balanced: The overall sentiment is well balanced.
conclusions.noIssues: There were no significant issues with sentiment detected.
